definitions.definition: to put one's body into a posture or series of postures, especially hoping that one will be noticed and admired
examples: If you're finished posturing in front of the mirror, can I use the bathroom now?

definitions.definition: to pretend to have an opinion or a conviction
examples: The politicians couldn't really care less about the issue: they're just posturing for the media.

definitions.definition: To place in a particular position or attitude; to pose .
examples: to posture oneself; to posture a model

main_definition: ( intransitive ) to put one's body into a posture or series of postures, especially hoping that one will be noticed and admired
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) to pretend to have an opinion or a conviction
( transitive ) To place in a particular position or attitude; to pose .
